org.missile.controller
Class GameController

java.lang.Object
  org.missile.controller.GameController

public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object

Controller of the application.

This class will handle all the requests of the view layer and send them to the model, where they will be processed.

Author:
Luis Carlos Mateos

Method Detail

startGame

public void startGame()
Starts a new instance of the game

addBase

public void addBase(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height,
                    int gunHeigth)
Sets the coordinates for a new base and send the creation order to the model.

Parameters:
x - base's bottom left point x coordinate
y - base's bottom left point y coordinate
width - width of the base
height - height of the base
gunHeigth - the height for the base's gun

addCity

public void addCity(int x,
                    int y,
                    int width,
                    int height)
Sets the coordinates for a new city and sends creation order to the model.

Parameters:
x - integer. base's bottom left x axis coordinate.
y - integer. base's bottom left y axis coordinate.
width - integer. width of the base
height - integer. height of the base

moveElements

public void moveElements()
Checks for any collisions and moves the elements

shootEnemyMissile

public void shootEnemyMissile(int x0,
                              int y0,
                              int x1,
                              int y1)
Sends the order to the model to launch an enemy missile

Parameters:
x0 - integer. origin x axis coordinate.
y0 - integer. origin y axis coordinate.
x1 - integer. destination x axis coordinate.
y1 - integer. destination y axis coordinate.

shootMissile

public void shootMissile(int x,
                         int y)
                  throws NoBasesLeftException
Launches an ally missile.

Parameters:
x - x axis coordinate targets point
y - y axis coordinate targets point
Throws:
NoBasesLeftException

aimGun

public void aimGun(int x,
                   int y)
            throws NoBasesLeftException
Sends the order to the model to aim a gun to the point (x,y)

Parameters:
x - x axis coordinate
y - y axis coordinate
Throws:
NoBasesLeftException - when there is no bases left so none could aim to the point.
